name: Hearty Breakfast Cookies
author: Janet Allen
summary: These cookies are a delicious and hearty alternative to doughnuts or pastries. Also great to pack in lunches and on trips. Try one with your morning coffee or tea. For a slightly richer treat, use buttermilk in place of the water. Substitute dates for the raisins, if you prefer.
directions: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
Grease two baking sheets or line them with parchment paper
In a large bowl, using an electric mixer, beat together butter, peanut butter, brown sugar, and vanilla until creamy
Mix together flours, oats, wheat germ, salt, cinnamon, and baking soda
Stir in raisins or dates (see Cook's Note)
Drop by ice cream scoopfuls  2 1/2 inches apart on prepared baking sheets
Bake in preheated oven for 18 to 20 minutes
Cool on baking sheet for 2 minutes, then transfer to cooling racks
